metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33655 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
When sending malicous data to kernel by ioctl cmdFBIOPUT_VSCREENINFO,kernel will write memory out of bounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-48-generic - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-48-generic-64k - 5.15.0-48.54
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1018-kvm - 5.15.0-1018.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1020-aws - 5.15.0-1020.24
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-48.54').

linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.23').

linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
